alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 4:37PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 436 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated an area of slow moving thunderstorms impacting areas from Goose Creek through portions of North Charleston into the Oakbrook, Crook Crossroads and Dorchester Estates areas. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Ladson, College Park, Sangaree, Crowfield Plantation, Knightsville, Jedburg, Lincolnville, Centerville, Driggerstown, Summerville Medical Center, Stallsville, Charleston Southern University, Oakbrook, Oakatee, Grove Hall and Carnes Crossroad.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
